meanings.sent1: The old book had liny pages that crinkled when turned.
meanings.sent2: Her face looked liny from years of smiling and frowning.
meanings.sent3: The liny paper airplane couldn't fly straight due to its creases.
meanings.sent4: The liny road stretched out before us, like a wrinkled ribbon.
meanings.sent5: The liny tree bark felt rough and textured to the touch.

meanings.definition: Having a lot of lines or stripes
meanings.sent1: The zebra's liny coat helped it blend into the tall grass.
meanings.sent2: The liny pattern on the fabric made it look stylish and modern.
meanings.sent3: The liny design on the wallpaper made the room feel busy.
meanings.sent4: Her liny dress made her look like a walking barcode.
meanings.sent5: The liny flag fluttered in the wind, displaying its stripes proudly.

meanings.sent1: The liny shadows of the fence crisscrossed the garden.
meanings.sent2: The liny clouds in the sky looked like brushstrokes on a canvas.
meanings.sent3: The liny pattern on the rug made it seem longer than it was.
meanings.sent4: His liny drawing of a sunset captured the simplicity of nature.
meanings.sent5: The liny reflection of the sun on the water shimmered like a golden thread.
